Finding B: The present work is the first, in both animal and human, to show that tissues harvested from cadaveric ligaments up to 72 hours postmortem represent an available reservoir of specific stem cell populations.
Finding C: Whether you decide to eat 30 minutes or two hours after your workout, Agnani stressed that this meal is just as important as the one you had before hitting the gym.

Medicine_174_p$Medicine_420_p$Medicine_2.text:
Finding A: The tetraspanin CD81 contains a large intramembrane cavity occupied by cholesterol, indicating the potential for functional modulation by small molecules.
Finding B: Together, we provide sound evidence of a disease-independent unfortunate relationship between well-defined pre-adult environmental hits and violent aggression, calling for more efficient prevention.
Finding C: Psychotherapy has made progress but is still being utilized by only a small portion of young people being treated with antipsychotics, according to the study.
Finding D: In this study, however, cumin - which was rated positively when presented with the label "Indian food" - did not result in a slower reaction time, unlike parmesan cheese, which yield slower reaction times and was rated positively when presented with the "parmesan cheese" label.

Medicine_507_p$Medicine_tweet_9_p$Medici.text:
Finding A: Seals gradually became more buoyant as they increased their fat stores while foraging over the course of the migration.
Finding B: RESULTS Adjusting for sociodemographics, maternal intelligence, and home environment in linear regression, longer breastfeeding duration was associated with higher Peabody Picture Vocabulary Test score at age 3 years (0.21; 95% CI, 0.03-0.38 points per month breastfed) and with higher intelligence on the Kaufman Brief Intelligence Test at age 7 years (0.35; 0.16-0.53 verbal points per month breastfed; and 0.29; 0.05-0.54 nonverbal points per month breastfed).
Finding C: "Because evidence shows that low HRV is a potential risk factor for sexual dysfunction, physicians have a simple, low-cost and nonintrusive method to measure a woman\'s risk for sexual dysfunction," said Stanton.
Finding D: This age profile refines earlier reports of steadily increasing rates of antipsychotic use across multiyear developmental categories of childhood to adolescence 28 to early adulthood.

Medicine_tweet_6_p$Medicine_435_r$Medici.text:
Finding A: We show here that Bmp9 is transiently expressed during digit joint cavitation and that BMP9 treatment stimulates joint regeneration.
Finding B: As people pack on pounds or shed excess weight, they exhibit notable changes in their microbiome, cardiovascular system, immune system and levels of gene expression, the study found.
Finding C: Extrapolating their results to tropical forests as a whole, the team calculated that lianas could potentially reduce long-term storage of carbon in tropical forests by one-third or more.
Finding D: "By relating these advanced neuroimaging measures back to the patient experience, we provide evidence that the future targeting of central inflammatory pathways may greatly enhance the quality of life of patients with rheumatoid arthritis and potentially other chronic inflammatory disorders."

Medicine_538_p$Medicine_tweet_97_r$Medic.text:
Finding A: Inversion of these data shows that a third of Harvey\'s total stormwater was captured on land (25.7 ± .0 km ), indicating that the rest drained rapidly into the ocean at a rate of 8.2 km
Finding B: Important paper out today with @username. Male infants and birth complications increase incidence of PND. #pnd #ppd #babyboy #obgyn #episiotomy #csection #difficultbirth #inflammation #evolutionarymedicine
Finding C: We conclude that population-based mortality statistics, at least in England, do not show a past benefit of breast cancer screening.
Finding D: Here we show that, although there are sex/gender differences in brain and behavior, humans and human brains are comprised of unique "mosaics" of features, some more common in females compared with males, some more common in males compared with females, and some common in both females and males.
